generator.group: Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research

contact.group: Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research

publications.title: Generation of two isogenic induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a 1-month-old nemaline myopathy patient harbouring a homozygous recessive c.121C > T (p.Arg39Ter) variant in the ACTA1 gene

donor.disease_description: Nemaline myopathy (NM) is a congenital skeletal muscle disorder that typically results in muscle weakness and the presence of rod-like structures (nemaline bodies) in the sarcoplasma and/or in the nuclei of myofibres. The donor carried a homozygous recessive mutation in the ACTA1 gene (c.121C > T, p.Arg39Ter).

genomic_modifications.description: Homozygous ACTA1 variant; NM_001100, c.121C > T
genomic_modifications.genotype: Homozygous ACTA1 variant; NM_001100, c.121C > T

genomic_characterisation.summary: At least 15 metaphases were counted and at least 5 analysed in-depth. Normal male karyotype.
